channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gold Prices Expected to Continue Rising in 2025
item.description: Spot gold held solid gains and Axis Securities said prices are expected to continue to rise in 2025 even though they’re in an overbought territory, as...

item.title: Vicious Partner Feud Roils EF Hutton
item.description: The investment bank that revived a storied brand made millions taking startups like Donald Trump’s social-media platform public. Now it’s beset by fig...

item.title: Why mortgage rates are back to nearly 7%
item.description: The average 30-year mortgage rate has surged over the course of October, returning to highs last seen in the summer.

item.title: Is it ‘desperate’ to use LinkedIn’s #OpenToWork button? Here’s what hiring experts really think.
item.description: The green banner helps let everyone in your professional network know that you’re looking for work. But does it help or harm a job search?

item.title: Oil Rebounds on Middle East Risks
item.description: Oil prices rebounded following the previous session’s selloff, but further gains will likely be capped by weak demand in China and prospects of a glob...

item.title: Eurozone activity contracts again in October, S&P PMI surveys suggest
item.description: The eurozone’s economy looks set to weaken further, with activity contracting for a second-straight month, as policymakers at the European Central Ban...

item.title: ‘I wish Dad were here’: I received $500,000 after my late father’s wrongful-death lawsuit. My adviser suggests annuities. How do I invest it?
item.description: “I do not want incredibly high-risk investments. I want moderate risk, but something statistically stable.”

item.title: Sterling Trims Gains After U.K. PMI Data Miss Forecasts
item.description: Sterling trimmed its gains after provisional U.K. PMI data for October missed expectations, with S&P saying cost pressures were easing, and the BOE co...

item.title: ‘I retired earlier than planned’: I’m 69 and will have $6,000 a month in retirement income. The bulk of my $3.6 million is equities. Is that OK?
item.description: “I don’t expect equities to do as well over the next decade as they have in the past, but I still think they will outperform other options.”

item.title: Keurig Dr Pepper Strikes $1 Billion Deal for Energy Drink Maker Ghost
item.description: The energy-drink market includes bigger rivals Monster Beverage and Celsius.
